intro: Mappia affinis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mappia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, pale yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in the summer months. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds.
